text: You guys. :smiley: THANK YOU

is there a way to use e.preventDefault in HubSpot embedded forms. I'm thinking using any global callback functions like onFormSubmit because i need some custom logic before the form gets submitted and prevent the submission if the logic fails.  So far haven't been able to make it work, any suggestions?
just listen for the `onFormReady` then get the button and add a listener on click to prevent the default logic :slightly_smiling_face:
Morning is there a work around for grouping fields together? I see its limited to 3… I need 4
cool, let me try
Grouping form fields right <@UGMGP7A72>?
have you checked this ? <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/grouping-fields-and-logic>
<@UCH1L597V> Thats right. Yep check this. I have built a custom mega menu but I can only group 3 levels down but I actually need 4 level of grouping.
this might help you ?<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-can-i-edit-an-advanced-menu-module>
<@UCH1L597V> Please see screenshot
As you can see I’m three groups deep. The red highlight would take me four deep. Unless there is a better way to do this
<@U7SL518D6> can help us in it
I found a work around by using richtext where I can add the URL and text together.
should work
thanks for sharing
sorry was sleeping. I typically use either HubDB or HubSpot’s Menu() function itself to do Mega Menus. This get’s around the 3 level depth issue
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/TheWebTech-Basic-Menu-using-Menu-Function?hsLang=en>
This is a good starter for building out menus with the menu function. It’s easy to simply add if statements to handle having different html at different depths and whatnot.
Hello everyone, is there a way to search only a specific tag for blog posts?

If you’re talking about site search, then I believe so...
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>

Optional filter param: *property*
How to use: *&property=*
Description: Specifies which properties to search for (defaulting to all properties). Options are title, description, and html. For blog posts, additional search properties are author_full_name, author_handle, and *tag*.
Thanks, think this is what I need :slightly_smiling_face:
for sure you can't have `{{ }}` inside `{% %}`
I think you just need to do `content.slug is string_startingwith item.lang_url`
or just go with what <@U6GNQ7JBU> recommended.  From my experience, he's always right
Ah I misread your message <@U54TVT3C1>, I thought you said `for sure you CAN have `{{ }}` inside `{% %}`
Thanks, <@U6GNQ7JBU>. I’ll give that a try
Thanks <@U54TVT3C1> --- Yeah, I was getting a parsing error before.  Let me give this a shot and see if it works.  Really appreciate the help.
No problem!  I think I might have an extra space in there before the `||`
<@U54TVT3C1> cool, I’ll double check that. About to drop it in now.
<@U54TVT3C1> <@U6GNQ7JBU> Awesome! I think I’m getting somewhere. That worked.
